description: A sophisticated phishing campaign targeted SBI customers through fraudulent emails mimicking official bank communications. The attackers created convincing replicas of SBI's online banking portal to steal customer credentials. Over 5,000 customers were potentially affected, with unauthorized transactions reported across multiple accounts. The bank immediately issued security advisories and implemented additional verification procedures for online transactions.

AIIMS Delhi faced a severe ransomware attack that crippled its digital infrastructure for several weeks. The attack affected patient registration systems, appointment scheduling, and medical records access. Critical care services had to revert to manual processes, causing significant delays in patient care. The incident highlighted vulnerabilities in healthcare IT infrastructure and the need for robust cybersecurity measures in medical institutions.

organization: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation
description: IRCTC's booking platform suffered a data breach exposing personal information of over 1 million passengers. The attack exploited SQL injection vulnerabilities in the online reservation system, allowing unauthorized access to passenger names, phone numbers, and travel history. The breach was discovered during routine security audits and prompted immediate system upgrades and security patches.

sources.title: IRCTC Data Breach Report - Times of India

description: RBI's online services faced a coordinated DDoS attack that disrupted access to regulatory portals and information systems for several hours. The attack targeted multiple endpoints simultaneously, causing service degradation during peak business hours. Quick response from the cybersecurity team and traffic filtering mechanisms helped restore services within 6 hours.

A series of SIM swapping attacks targeted high-value Airtel customers, resulting in unauthorized access to banking and digital payment accounts. Attackers exploited customer service processes to transfer phone numbers to attacker-controlled SIM cards, enabling them to bypass two-factor authentication. The incident led to enhanced verification procedures for SIM replacement requests.

A sophisticated Advanced Persistent Threat group attempted to infiltrate PGCI's operational technology networks through targeted spear-phishing emails. The attack aimed to establish persistence in critical infrastructure systems. Quick detection by security monitoring systems prevented any disruption to power grid operations, but highlighted the growing threat to critical infrastructure.

An insider threat incident at ISRO involved unauthorized access to sensitive satellite technology research data by a contractor with elevated privileges. The incident was detected through anomalous data access patterns and led to comprehensive review of access control policies and background verification procedures for personnel handling classified information.

sources.title: ISRO Security Incident - Space News India

description: TCS detected malware infiltration through a compromised third-party software component used in client project development. The incident triggered immediate isolation of affected systems and comprehensive security audits across all client environments. Enhanced supplier security assessments were implemented following the incident.

Coal India's public website was defaced by activists protesting environmental policies. The attackers exploited vulnerabilities in an outdated content management system to alter the homepage content. While no sensitive data was compromised, the incident highlighted the need for regular security updates and monitoring of public-facing websites.

sources.title: Coal India Website Defacement - Indian Express

description: LIC customers were targeted through SMS phishing campaigns claiming policy lapses and requesting immediate online verification. The fraudulent messages directed users to fake LIC portals designed to steal login credentials and personal information. The company issued widespread alerts and enhanced customer education about phishing threats.

A misconfigured database at NIC exposed citizen data from various government services for several days before being discovered during a security audit. The exposed data included names, addresses, and identification numbers from multiple e-governance applications. Immediate remediation was undertaken and affected citizens were notified.

Jio's network infrastructure faced a massive DDoS attack that caused service degradation in major metropolitan areas during peak hours. The attack targeted core network nodes with volumetric traffic, causing intermittent connectivity issues for millions of subscribers. Network resilience measures and traffic rerouting restored full service within 4 hours.

sources.title: Jio Network Attack Report - Telecom News

description: HDFC Bank discovered skimming devices installed on multiple ATMs across Delhi and Mumbai, designed to steal customer card data and PINs. The sophisticated devices were nearly undetectable and operated for several weeks before discovery during routine maintenance. Enhanced ATM monitoring and customer advisories were immediately implemented.

sources.title: HDFC ATM Skimming Alert - Money Control

description: DMRC's administrative systems were hit by ransomware delivered through malicious email attachments. While passenger-facing services remained operational, back-office functions including payroll and procurement were temporarily disrupted. The incident led to enhanced email security measures and mandatory cybersecurity training for all employees.

sources.title: Delhi Metro Ransomware Attack - Metro News

description: Malware infiltrated IOC's corporate network through infected USB drives used by contractors. The malware attempted lateral movement across the network before being contained by endpoint detection systems. The incident resulted in stricter removable media policies and enhanced endpoint protection across all facilities.

sources.title: IOC Malware Incident - Energy Security Report
